thread.title: Rightmove's most viewed property: A footballer's palace, £80,000 Cornish pad and a fishtank
thread.title_full: Rightmove's most viewed property: A footballer's palace, £80,000 Cornish pad and a fishtank

title: Rightmove's most viewed property: A footballer's palace, £80,000 Cornish pad and a fishtank
text:
18.73 -0.10 
From London's skinniest mansion to a party house complete with a therapy room - here are the five properties that have caught your eye so far in 2015 
Britain has become a nation of property junkies, trawling search websites such as Rightmove (LSE: RMV.L - news ) and Zoopla to ogle the most lavish homes or peer through the virtual window at strange decor and freaky living styles. 
Here are the five homes that caused a stir on Rightmove in the first half of the year, racking up the highest viewing numbers on the website from January to June. 
= Footballer's pad = 
This 11-bedroom mansion has footballer's pad written all over it - from the red leather chairs in the long dining room to the wooden ladder needed to reach the wine rack sunken into the kitchen wall. 
Warford Hall belongs to former pro footballer Ashley Ward - who started his professional career with Manchester City in 1989 and finished it with Sheffield United in 2005. 
The house on Merrymans' Lane. 
In Alderley Edge, Cheshire, the stomping ground of many a Manchester United (NYSE: MANU - news ) or Liverpool player, the property is on the market with Jackson Stops & Staff. Price on application. 
Where there's a Premiership footballer there's often a wag, or in this case a professional designer. Mrs Ward has his and her's ensuite bathrooms and beauty salon suite. 
A bar room tucked away in the house which features a giant fishtank. 
The party house has a bar which comes complete with a giant fishtank, cinema and games room, as well as a swimming pool and gym and every year the couple throw a star-studded bash. 
But if the ostentation becomes a bit much there's also a ready-made therapy room. 
Over 175,000 people viewed the property via Rightmove out of curiosity following press stories on footballers in the Cheshire golden triangle who have struggled to sell their homes. The house has been on the market since 2013. Could it be the the giant fish tank in the bar? 
A long dining room for hosting guests before retiring to the games room. 
= A most modern mansion = 
Sprawling new build mansions are often designed to appeal to domestic wealth or Russian buyers who bring their family over to live in Surrey. 
This £24.5m home is over 22,000 sq ft and set in four acres of landscaped and wooded grounds, with a long carriage drive worthy of a scene from Pride and Prejudice. It is one of the biggest new mansions in the Ascot area. 
Windlesham House near Ascot. 
Now (NYSE: DNOW - news ) standard place in such properties, there is a 14-seat cinema, games room and garage for six cars. 
The new build property is on the market with Knight Frank. 
Over 150,000 people viewed the eight-bedroom home online - window gazing at what £24.5m will get you in Surrey. 
Glass of wine? 
= Sea view at a snip = 
An £80,000 flat in Cornwall, with beautiful views overlooking the sea. So what's the catch? 
A view of the harbour in Penzance. 
The floor plan says it all. The 285sq ft apartment in Penzance has three rooms. A kitchen-living room, bathroom and bedroom. 
Perfect if you are planning to spend all day on the beach and all evening dining by the habour, but with nowhere to hang your wetsuit. 
The kitchen-cum-diner-cum living room. 
The advert doesn't give a lot of detail about the three rooms - there's not a lot to say - but does emphasise the bay window and abundance of natural light. 
However, it's caught the eye of property perusers - 134,000 people viewed this property on Rightmove making it the fourth most 'clicked on' home on the site in the first half of the year. 
= Skinny house = 
A state-of-the-art London mansion suitable for the rich and famous, and model types, due to its £39m price tag and width. It's one of the skinny homes on sale in the upper echelons of the capital's property market. 
The 50ft foot kitchen-dining room. 
Just off Berkeley Square in the heart of Mayfair it may be narrow, but it's very tall - covering 13,564sq ft and six floors. 
The master boudoir - one of eight bedrooms. 
The Tardis-esq mansion has a lift to all floors and a grand sweeping staircase. 
It's on the market with Beauchamp Estates and 125,000 property hunters viewed it on Rightmove from January to June this year. 
Built in 1753 the house is now equipped with 21st century touches such as a cinema or 'media' room. 
The Charles Street property was also one of the most viewed on Rightmove in 2014 and was last sold in 2000 for around £3m. 
The skinny mansion in all its glory. 
= Back in Cheshire = 
Spankingly large mansions are not the preserve of the South East. Cheshire boasts many a palatial pad. But your millions go further up North. 
This eight-bedroom home in Bowden is on the market for £6.95m. 
Commutable into Manchester from the nearby station at Hale. 
Built by its current owners in 2008, it has a gym, indoor pool and an acre of landscaped gardens. 
The infinity pool with doors that lead out on to the garden. 
Over 100,000 property hunters viewed this home in just six months. 
The family room and if this TV isn't big enough there's always the cinema room. Of course.
